item.title: Contact
item.description: Email: moshepol[at]mit[dot]edu Twitter LinkedIn Fun Fact: Some words are regular travelers, going on vacation abroad and returning with a newfound accent. Consider the Arabic dār al-ṣināʿa (literally, house of manufacture; that is, a factory). It was borrowed into Latin around the middle of the previous millenium as arsana, eventually becoming the English arsenal. Not quite a place of production, but a place for storage of weapons (“arsenal, n.

item.title: Moshe Poliak
item.description: I am an incoming PhD student at MIT Brain and Cognitive Sciences. I study psycholinguistics, or what processes in the mind are involed in language production and comprehension. Specifically, I study language as a social act and how our knowledge of our conversation partners affects how we comprehend and produce language. This will get more concrete over my time in graduate school :) In the past, I have worked with Anthony Yacovone and Dr.
